snippet: At a private lunch, Ms. Lee seemed breezily self-assured about the book’s publication next Tuesday, despite the mystery surrounding its discovery.
abstract: Harper Lee receives copy of Go Set a Watchman, book she wrote 60 years ago, at lunch for publishing insiders in Monroeville, Ala; novel, written before her acclaimed To Kill a Mockingbird, is shrouded in mystery regarding how and when manuscript was discovered; book's long anticipated release was touted by walking tours, lectures, marathon readings and other promotional events.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA ALTER and SERGE F. KOVALESKI

lead_paragraph: At a private lunch, Ms. Lee seemed breezily self-assured about the book’s publication next Tuesday, despite the mystery surrounding its discovery.

headline.main: Harper Lee Receives Copy of ‘Go Set a Watchman’ as Release Nears
headline.print_headline: Harper Lee Receives a Copy of Her Disputed Book
